I think I found quite big hole in 2.0.40 build. It's related with SSI and PHP parsing. When trying to include more than one .php file in different locations of the html code inside .shtml file the 1st outputs nicely but the rest ones after that doesn't parse at all. I am using PHP version 4.2.3-dev and windows 2000 pro with servicepack 3. An easy setup to find the error: make test.shtml that has this: --------------------------
-------------------------- save and into the same folder make phpinfo.php that has this inside: -------------------------- -------------------------- Now when opening test.shtml it should print phpinfo 2 times, right? The actual output only has phpinfo listed once and the second include comes into html source as . It seems that the server doesn't parse the 2nd php file included. If I disable the first include (example point it to file that doesn't exists) the second one starts working. No errors are generated into the error.log file. I haven't tested this on 1.3.26 version but what I've heard it works fine in it, so I quess this is only 2.x issue at the moment. Sorry if I made this bugreport some wrong way, I'm quite newbie to apache and php and I understand if this issue is just becouse I'm not aware of something. I rounded many irc channels to get confirmation about this and ppl who helped me considered this also as a bugissue of apache. ___________ Vesa Laakso
